para: Enhance intensity differences between the lighter and darker portions of the given ℑ.

In a circle of the given radius (in pixel units), around each pixel in the image, the minimum and maximum intensity of all pixels in the circle are computed. The central pixel's intensity is set to either the minimum or maximum, depending on which is closer to the pixel's original value. In color images, the RGB channels are handled independently.
This routine is similar to skimage.filters.rank.enhance_contrast in &skimage;, but it is applied to each RGB channel separately, and does not reduce the color resolution to 8 bits.

caption.para: The top row consists of two unprocessed images, a 200×200 micrograph of Si3N4 (courtesy of C.-H. Hsueh) and a 640×375 print by M.C. Escher. In the bottom row, the contrast has been enhanced with radius=5 for the micrograph and radius=10 for the print.
